creditline: The Ellen and Fred Wells Fund
description: round-bottomed jar with neck opening into flaring lip; two small v-shaped handles below neck on body; has own stand
text: This elegant, thin-walled jar is an early example of wheel-turned pottery in Korea and represents significant advancement over the rough, coil-built vessels produced earlier.  Since such jars with flaring necks, round bottoms and unusual "ox-horn" handles have only been discovered among funerary remains, it is likely that they once held ceremonial offerings.
title: Jar
